business.headline: Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

DreamFolks crisis explained: What's going on and what it means for investorsFounded in 2013, DreamFolks acted as a platform connecting banks, credit card companies, and passengers to airport lounges, food services, baggage handling, and other airport amenities.

US Fed cuts rates for 1st time this year. Will it give a boost to Dalal Street?Lower US interest rates tend to make emerging markets like India more attractive to foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), as dollar assets lose some shine and Treasury yields ease.

Urban Company shares register bumper debut on Dalal Street, but what's next?Urban Company's shares, issued at Rs 103, opened at Rs 162.25 and surged as much as 74% during the day. For those who got shares in the IPO, that meant instant profits and a near $3 billion market value for the company.

Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. Unilever, which is spinning off its ice cream business, thanked Greenfield for his service but disagreed with his claims.

IT, defence or PSU banking: Which sector is likely to see growth on D-Street?PSU banking stocks have started gaining attention after a long period of underperformance, while the IT sector remains in a state of uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty continue winning run amid India-US trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 313.02 points to close at 82,693.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 91.25 points to end at 25,330.25. Broader markets also held their ground, with midcap and smallcap indices finishing in the green.

Business leaders extend heartfelt wishes to PM Modi on 75th birthdayProminent business leaders across India as he celebrated his 75th birthday on Tuesday, with several industrialists praising his transformational leadership and unwavering commitment to the nation's progress.

Want a home loan without the headache? Here's how AI can help youFrom lengthy paperwork to long waiting periods, applying for a home loan often becomes a tedious process filled with red tape, but an AI tool can now make it easy for you.

Cotton farmers face new challenge as quality issues threaten MSPDuring this Kharif season, northern states such as Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, and southern states including Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, experienced prolonged and abnormal rainfall.
Elon Musk congratulates Siddharth Jain, India Inc's 1st executive to own a TeslaElon Musk congratulated Siddharth Jain of INOX Group on owning the first Tesla in India Inc.

$1 billion startup BlackBuck leaves Bengaluru office, blames potholesBengaluru firm BlackBuck, worth over $1 billion has decided to move out of their office in the city due to worsening pothole conditions.

BEL share price: Why is it rising today and should you buy?BEL shares rose during the trading session on strong Rs 712 crore order inflow, supported by robust backlog and bullish technicals, keeping investor sentiment positive and suggesting potential further upside in the near-term trading sessions.

Urban Company shares list at 58% premium: Should you book profit or hold?Urban Company share price: The strong debut reflects the high demand for Urban Company's IPO, which had been among the most closely watched offerings of 2025.

Urban Company share price: Stock makes bumper debut at 58% premiumUrban Company listed at a 57.5% premium at Rs 162.25 on the NSE. On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 161, marking a 56% gain over the Rs 103 issue price.

Experts bet big on this financial stock at record high. Should you buy?Experts recommend the financial stock as a strong buy for investors focusing on financial stocks, while also suggesting PSU banks, defence tech firms, and auto ancillary stocks as potential picks.

DreamFolks share price tumble 5% today. Why is it under pressure?DreamFolks shares fell sharply in early trade after the company quit the domestic lounge business, a move that could reshape its position in India's fast-evolving airport services market.

Urban Company shares debut on BSE, NSE today. Will it be a blockbuster listing?Urban Company share price: The company's stock market debut also comes at a time when benchmark indices are riding high on optimism around US-India trade talks and a widely expected Fed rate cut, factors that could further shape sentiment on its first trading day.

Sensex, Nifty open higher on upbeat trade talks, Fed rate cut in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 250.84 points higher at 82,631.53 at 9:24 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 78.15 points to 25,317.25. Volatility dropped sharply and most of the broader market indices were trading in the green.

Explained: Why Apollo Tyres shares are in focus todayApollo Tyres shares have gained 6% over the past month, even as they remain over 6% lower on a year-to-date basis. Analysts say the brand exposure from the deal could create long-term consumer stickiness, though the immediate financial payoff remains a question for the market.
Will ITR deadline be extended further as users complain of glitches?The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) had already extended the filing deadline by one day, from September 15 to September 16.

Urban Company listing today: Will it double investor wealth on market debut?Urban Company's IPO received overwhelming demand from all categories of investors despite some analysts calling it expensive and the subdued market conditions.

Missed September 16 ITR deadline? Here's how to file your return nowA look at options and consequences for taxpayers who do not file their income tax return by the extended due date of 16 September 2025, including late filing penalties, deadlines for belated returns, and whether tax regimes can be changed.

Confident of good outcome under PM Modi: Hardeep Puri on US-India trade talksAs US-India trade talks resumed with the arrival of the US chief negotiator in India, Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri expressed confidence of a good outcome under PM Modi.

India–US trade talks resume with 'India First' focus, says Hardeep Singh PuriAs fresh trade talks begin between India and the US, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, in an exclusive interview with India Today said the government will prioritise national interests, with farmers and MSMEs at the heart of its strategy.

How will US-India trade talk impact markets ahead?Experts said that any progress in the India-US trade deal is likely to trigger short covering on Dalal Street and the market is also looking forward to pent-up consumer demand from Navaratri.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags regulatory risk for weekly optionsWeekly options in India are under scrutiny, and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has warned about the mounting regulatory risks that could reshape trading in these short-term derivatives.
Sensex jumps 595 points, Nifty above 25,200; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 594.95 points to close at 82,380.69 points, while the NSE Nifty50 added 169.90 points to end at 25,239.10.

Apollo Tyres shares jump 2% after it's named India cricket team jersey sponsorApollo Tyres shares jumped to the day's high of Rs 490.80 after opening at Rs 479.45. Apollo Tyres shares closed at Rs 486.80, up 1.56% after the news.

Can a Rs 25,000 salary fund both your home and car?Think a Rs 25,000 salary can't get you a house and a car? Think again. With the right strategy and disciplined savings, even modest paychecks can turn into big dreams.

Mother Dairy slashes ghee, butter prices, tetra-pack milk cheaper by Rs 2Mother Dairy announced a cut in prices across its portfolio of dairy and processed foods, saying it is passing on the benefits of the government's GST 2.0 reforms directly to consumers.
Urban Company to debut on BSE, NSE: What investors can expect on listing dayUrban Company is set to list on the BSE and NSE on September 17, 2025 after its IPO was subscribed nearly 109 times.

Say cheese: Trump blinks on trade as talks resume with IndiaIndia-US trade negotiations have resumed, weeks after Trump imposed steep 50% tariffs last month. The US, now, doesn't want sweeping access to India's agricultural and dairy markets.

1-day ITR extension: Is it enough for taxpayers?Filing income tax returns turned into a nightmare this year, as taxpayers battled login errors, frozen screens and missed payments. Now, with just a one-day extension, many are asking, is that really enough?

System is tainted: Delhi family's 6-year fight over Rs 55,000 insurance claimIn this week's story, part of our ongoing series' Claim Denied,' we tell the story of a Delhi family whose insurance claim was denied and whose battle is still ongoing after six years.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 episode 25: Mass nominations after rule break shake up the houseIn 'Bigg Boss 19' episode 25, housemates were punished with mass nominations after breaking the rules, leading to heated confrontations, emotional breakdowns, and shifting alliances. The captaincy task further fuelled chaos with physical tussles, insults, and high drama inside the house.

The Summer I Turned Pretty finale had the most Bollywood, desi ending ever'The Summer I Turned Pretty' finale gave fans the ultimate Bollywood-style ending. From Belly and Conrad's dreamy Paris train reunion to echoes of 'DDLJ' and Yash Raj romances, here's why the show's last episode felt like pure desi cinema magic.

Actor Raghava Lawrence opens meal center, calls it a venture close to his heartTamil actor-director Raghava Lawrence named the meal center after his mother, and shared that the initiative aims to make food varieties that are usually consumed by the wealthy accessible to people with lower economic backgrounds.

Who is Larissa Bonesi, Aryan Khan's rumoured girlfriend, at Ba***ds premiere?Brazilian model-actor Larissa Bonesi, rumoured to be Aryan Khan's girlfriend, stole the spotlight at the premiere of his Netflix debut 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' in Mumbai.

Court quashes FIR against Yo Yo Honey Singh in 'Makhna' song caseA Mohali court has quashed the FIR against singer Yo Yo Honey Singh regarding alleged objectionable lyrics in his 2018 song 'Makhna' after both complainants stated they had no objection to closure.

Kajol's 'beep beeps of Bollywood' joke cracks up SRK and Ajay Devgn'The Bads of Bollywood', rolled out its red carpet with a premiere that was equal parts glitz and giggles. Kajol shared a clip where her quick-witted humour stole the spotlight.

Deepika Padukone dropped from Kalki 2, producers say sequel deserves commitmentDeepika Paudkone will not be a part of the sequel to director Nag Ashwin's 'Kalki 2898 AD', production house Vyjayanthi Movies announced. A film like 'Kalki' deserves commitment and much more, the official statement read.

Prabhas' next period film Fauji to feature Abhishek Bachchan in key role: ReportActor Prabhas is currently working on 'Fauji', a pre-Independence love story directed by Hanu Raghavapudi. Reports suggest that Abhishek Bachchan has been roped in for a key role in the project.

Exclusive: Son Ye-jin praises Park Chan-wook's eye for awkward momentsSon Ye-jin shares her experience working with Park Chan-wook on 'No Other Choice' in an exclusive interaction with India Today at BIFF. The actor highlights the director's meticulous approach, offering new insights into performance and filmmaking.

Harshvardhan Rane supports Aamir Khan, pledges to bear his own entourage expensesActor Harshvardhan Rane has pledged to pay for his own entourage expenses, supporting producers amid the ongoing debate on soaring star costs in Bollywood. His statement comes after Aamir Khan, Varun Dhawan, and other industry voices raised concerns over the issue.

SRK's adorable photo-op with media, shot by Aryan, wins internetShah Rukh Khan, joined by Gauri Khan, daughter Suhana, and son AbRam, attended the screening of Aryan Khan's debut series 'The B***ds of Bollywood'. Among the many viral moments from the event, one clip of SRK striking poses with the paparazzi has particularly captured attention.

Pawan Kalyan's OG tickets for special show priced at Rs 1,000 in Andhra PradeshThe Andhra Pradesh government has allowed special benefit shows for Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' with tickets priced at Rs 1,000. The ticket prices have been increased for both single screens and multiplexes for the first ten days after release.

Exclusive: Lee Byung-hun credits Park Chan-wook's precision for his toughest roleIn an exclusive chat with India Today in Busan, actor Lee Byung-hun opened up about how Park Chan-wook's razor-sharp direction shaped his challenging role in 'No Other Choice'. The film, which had the honour of opening the Busan International Film Festival, also marks Son Ye-jin's much-awaited return to the screen after seven years.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle storms Indian box office, races past Bollywood hits'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – Infinity Castle' has taken the Indian box office by storm, earning Rs 51.20 crore in six days and outpacing many Bollywood and Hollywood releases. The movie is currently running in theatres worldwide.

Ranbir-Alia, Madhuri Dixit and celebs shine at The Ba***ds of Bollywood premiereMadhuri Dixit, Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Bollywood's biggest stars lit up The 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere with glamour, style, and star power.

Prime Video renews We Were Liars for a darker, twistier Season 2Prime Video has greenlit a second season of the hit thriller 'We Were Liars', after a debut that enthralled audiences with its intoxicating blend of privilege, secrets, and betrayal. The new chapter promises sharper twists and a darker dive into the Sinclair family's haunting past.

Mirai box office Day 6: Teja Sajja film adds Rs 4.5 crore after Rs 100 crore runTeja Sajja and Manoj Manchu's 'Mirai' added another Rs 4.5 crore nett to the box office collection on Day 6. The film surpassed Rs 100 crore globally within a week.

One last summer: The Summer I Turned Pretty gets its finale moviePrime Video is giving 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' a curtain call – a feature film that will bring the beloved saga to its grand finale, with creator Jenny Han and the original cast stepping back into the spotlight.

Samay Raina wears 'Say no to cruise' T-shirt at The Ba***ds of Bollywood screeningComedian Samay Raina wore a T-shirt with the message 'Say no to cruise' at 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere. The statement is seen as an indirect reference to Aryan Khan's 2021 drug case linked to a cruise party.

general news.headline: 6,000 voter names deleted in Karnataka's Aland: Rahul Gandhi presents 'proof'Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday sharpened his 'vote chori' attack on the BJP and the Election Commission as he came armed with proof of systemic voter fraud, with Karnataka's Aland constituency as the prime example.

Baseless: Election Commission on Rahul Gandhi's charge against CEC Gyanesh KumarThe poll body acknowledged that certain unsuccessful attempts were made to delete electors in Karnataka's Aland Assembly Constituency, and an FIR was filed by the Election Commission of India to investigate the matter.

Godabai, Suryakant, Nagaraj: The 'proof' in Rahul Gandhi's new voter fraud bombRahul Gandhi presented three case studies while accusing the Election Commission of mass deletion of voters from Congress strongholds ahead of the 2023 Karnataka election. Let's have a look at the evidence presented by Gandhi.

Will Saudi involve itself if India, Pak go to war again? What the deal meansSaudi Arabia has signed a defence pact with nuclear-armed Pakistan, vowing that any attack on either nation will be considered an attack on both. Analysts have called the pact nothing but posturing. What does it mean for India?

Deepika Padukone dropped from Kalki 2, producers say sequel deserves commitmentDeepika Paudkone will not be a part of the sequel to director Nag Ashwin's 'Kalki 2898 AD', production house Vyjayanthi Movies announced. A film like 'Kalki' deserves commitment and much more, the official statement read.

Rahul Gandhi wants to create Nepal-like unrest in India: BJP on vote chori chargeRahul Gandhi wants to create Bangladesh and Nepal-like situation in India, BJP's Anurag Thaku said while slamming his 'vote chori' charge against the Centre and Election Commission.

71-year-old US woman travelled to Punjab to marry UK-based NRI, 75; found deadThe incident dates back to July when Rupinder Kaur Pandher, an American citizen based in Seattle, arrived in Ludhiana at the invitation of Charanjit Singh Grewal, the 75-year-old would-be groom.

Needed: A Smiling Buddha for Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen BombRahul Gandhi, the Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, has alleged manipulation of the election process with a second media meet in less than two months. Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar earlier aggressively countered Rahul, seeking an affidavit. The EC needs to probe and assure people that polls in India are free and fair. And this, CEC Kumar must do calmly.

How Pakistan uses just two cards to tap the Islamic ummahPakistan, the only Muslim nuclear-powered country, pitched for an Islamic NATO. It has signed a defence pact with Saudi Arabia, legitimising its nuclear weapons for Riyadh's use if attacked. Pakistan has used just two cards—nuclear and Islamic—to tap the ummah, with the ulterior motive of seeking aid.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

Iron Beam: Israel unveils Star Wars-style laser defence systemRafael Advanced Defence Systems officially released the Iron Beam laser system this week that could change modern military warfare forever.

The Summer I Turned Pretty finale had the most Bollywood, desi ending ever'The Summer I Turned Pretty' finale gave fans the ultimate Bollywood-style ending. From Belly and Conrad's dreamy Paris train reunion to echoes of 'DDLJ' and Yash Raj romances, here's why the show's last episode felt like pure desi cinema magic.

Live: Allegation is Rahul Gandhi's 'ornament', habitually makes false claims, says BJPRahul Gandhi vote chori press meeting Live: Congress MP and Lok Sabha LoP Rahul Gandhi steps up attack on the Election Commission, alleging large-scale voter deletions through software-driven fraud; presents 'evidence' from Karnataka to back claims. Rahul Gandhi said he would soon come out with a "hydrogen bomb" of revelations about "vote chori".

Why some adults never want to have sex? Science decodedUsing one of the largest datasets of its kind, the research analysed responses from more than 4,00,000 UK adults and 13,500 Australians to understand why some people never engage in sexual activity.

Helicopter only after you resign: What Nepal Army chief told Oli amid Gen Z protestsAs violent Gen Z-led protests engulfed Nepal, including the capital Kathmandu, then PM KP Sharma Oli's plea for a helicopter for a safe exit was met with army chief Ashok Raj Sigdel's condition. He asked Oli to resign first, says a report. This sealed the fate of the Oli regime, which faced heat over corruption and authoritarianism.

Neeraj vs Arshad: Why India vs Pakistan in the javelin final is only a subplotWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem's rivalry will grab subcontinental headlines, but the men's javelin final in Tokyo is stacked with world-class talent. From Germany's Julian Weber to former champions Anderson Peters and Julius Yego, the contest promises far more than just an India-Pakistan subplot.

UPSC, IIT prep waste '8 prime years' of India's brightest minds: Startup founderStartup founder Akhil Suhag has sparked debate by criticising India's obsession with entrance exams, claiming they waste "8 prime years" of students' lives and kill raw talent before it reaches global potential.

ATC staffer falls asleep, plane hovers over airport for an hourAn Air Corsica flight circled Ajaccio Airport in Corsica for nearly an hour after the lone air traffic controller on duty fell asleep during the night shift. With no response from the control tower, the plane prepared to divert until fire crews and police found the controller asleep. After waking up, he cleared the flight for a safe landing.

The smart guide to choosing the right protein supplement for your dietProtein plays a crucial role in your fitness and wellness, but choosing the right supplement can be confusing. This simple guide breaks it down for you.

As Nano Banana becomes a hit in India, Google tells how you can spot AI imagesNano Banana AI images have quickly taken over social media, with India becoming the largest market for the new Google Gemini feature. If you find the swarm of AI images on the internet, a bit much, or just happen to care about your privacy, Google has a few pointers for you.
Video: BJP MP's terrifying encounter with Uttarakhand landslideThe Rajya Sabha MP shared the chilling video on social media, which shows him standing on a stretch of a road as a hillside collapses.

What is a hydrogen bomb? Not Rahul Gandhi's, the real oneWhile Rahul used the metaphor to describe a political-cum-electoral expose, the phrase has drawn attention to the terrifying reality of the actual hydrogen bomb.

Day 6 Live Updates: Neeraj Chopra aims to defend crown in javelin finalWorld Athletics Championships Day 6 Live: The spotlight will be on Neeraj Chopra as he aims to defend his crown at the World Athletics Championships on Thursday, September 18. Neeraj will be up against a strong field that includes compatriot Sachin Yadav and arch-rival and Olympic champion, Arshad Nadeem. Apart from this, India's Pooja Olla will be in action in the 800m heats.

sports.headline: UAE play as a family: Waseem dismisses rift in camp amid India-Pakistan tensionsUAE captain Muhammad Waseem highlights unity within the team despite Indo-Pak political tensions. The squad remains focused on cricket as India and Pakistan prepare to face each other again in the Super Four stage.

Lionel Messi and Inter Miami enter discussions for contract extension: ReportsLionel Messi is set to extend his Inter Miami stay, with reports indicating a deal until 2027. His stunning impact on MLS has transformed the club and boosted American soccer's global profile.

Swiatek to become No.1? Sabalenka's China Open pullout spices up raceAryna Sabalenka's withdrawal from the China Open opens the door for Iga Swiatek to close the gap in the race for the WTA No.1 ranking. A strong run in Seoul and Beijing could bring Swiatek within striking distance of the top spot.

Neeraj will be up against a strong field that includes compatriot Sachin Yadav and arch-rival and Olympic champion, Arshad Nadeem. Apart from this, India's Pooja Olla will be in action in the 800m heats.

From Germany's Julian Weber to former champions Anderson Peters and Julius Yego, the contest promises far more than just an India-Pakistan subplot.

Akeal Hosein captain, 5 uncapped players in as West Indies reveal Nepal series squadWest Indies have announced their squad for the upcoming historic series against Nepal with five uncapped players included in the mix. Akeal Hosein will be leading the team in the absence of many senior players.

Watch: Won Myong-gyong hugs referee in joy after World Wrestling Championships goldWon Myong-gyong clinched the women's 50 kg gold at the 2025 World Wrestling Championships, defeating China's Yu Zhang in the final. Her victory, highlighted by a heartfelt hug with the referee, marked only her country's third women's world title.

Yashasvi Jaiswal's white-ball format absence seems like a travesty: Aakash ChopraFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra feels that Yashasvi Jaiswal not being part of India's white-ball setup seems like a travesty. Jaiswal has played just 23 T20Is and one ODI for India during his career so far.

Diego Simeone opens up on altercation with Liverpool fan: Insulted for 90 minutesLiverpool snatched a dramatic 3-2 win over Atletico Madrid with Van Dijk's stoppage-time header. Simeone opened up on constant fan abuse, while Arne Slot urged focus remain on his team's late-game heroics.

PV Sindhu storms past Pornpawee Chochuwong to book quarters berthPV Sindhu stormed into the China Masters Super 750 quarterfinals with a commanding 21-15, 21-15 win over World No.6 Pornpawee Chochuwong, her third last-eight appearance of the year.

A study in calm: Neeraj Chopra's effortless path to the World FinalNeeraj Chopra enters the javelin final at the World Athletics Championships 2025 chasing a third consecutive medal and with the aim of retaining his crown. While Paris redemption, Arshad Nadeem rivalry and retaining his crown adds to the pressure of the final, Neeraj remains quietly confident of a good showing in Tokyo on Thursday, September 18.

Watch: Won Myong-gyong hugs referee in joy after World Wrestling Championships goldWon Myong-gyong clinched the women's 50 kg gold at the 2025 World Wrestling Championships, defeating China's Yu Zhang in the final. Her victory, highlighted by a heartfelt hug with the referee, marked only her country's third women's world title.

While Paris redemption, Arshad Nadeem rivalry and retaining his crown adds to the pressure of the final, Neeraj remains quietly confident of a good showing in Tokyo on Thursday, September 18.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
